TEXT.English: Active Defense allows patrolling fighters to engage enemy troops closing on them. This includes fighters on patrol in any location (city, carrier, etc). They will automatically engage the enemy in an airstrike when the enemy comes within 2 plots of the aircraft.
TEXT.German: Aktive Verteidigung erlaubt es patroullierenden Jägern feindliche Truppen anzugreifen, die sich ihnen nähern. Dies betrifft Jäger auf Patrouille in beliebigen Geländefeldern (Stadt, Flugzeugträger, etc.). Sie werden autmatisch den Luftkampf starten, wenn sich der Feind auf 2 Felder Entfernung nähert.
TEXT.Italian: Difesa Attiva consente ai caccia in pattugliamento di attaccare unità nemiche in avvicinamento. Questo include tutti i caccia in pattuglia su ogni obbiettivo (città, portaerei, ecc.). I caccia attaccheranno automaticamente il nemico quando questo si avvicinierà nel raggio di 2 caselle.
Difesa Attiva

TEXT.English: by PieceOfMind[PARAGRAPH:2]Right from the outset, make sure you understand that all odds in the Advanced Combat Odds display are rounded to 1 or 2 decimal places. Displayed odds of 100.00%, for example, could represent 99.995% or greater meaning the odds are not certain. Similarly, 0.00% does not mean zero odds - just very small odds.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are now four settings for the level of detail you wish to have displayed using this mod: Low, Medium, High and Everything! Medium is the default setting and recommended for most users.[PARAGRAPH:2]Advanced Combat Odds aims to be more accurate, relevant and informative than the original odds calculator. See the included text file for a list of features available at each detail setting.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]What do all the values mean?[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Survival Odds:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]These are simple - the odds of both the attacker (green) and defender (red) surviving. Sometimes using units like catapults means the defender will have 100% odds; This is because the attacker cannot kill the defender and must withdraw before dealing a killing blow.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Victory:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The odds of the attacker killing the defender. Also presented on this line is the number of XP the attacker would earn if he wins. At Medium detail and higher, there is an additional value on this line. This value is the average hitpoints of the attacker if he kills the defender.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Withdraw:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]These are the odds of a forced withdrawal from combat. Units like catapults and cannons, which have a combat limit, cannot kill a defending unit. Instead they can only damage the defender down to a certain level (eg. 25HP for catapults, 20HP for cannons, 15HP for artillery). The XP a unit earns for withdrawal is 1XP. At the end of this line, the average values of both attacker and defender HP are presented for the withdrawal battle outcome (for Medium detail and higher). Note average defender HP on this line corresponds to the damage limit of the unit you are using to attack.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Retreat:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you are using units that have inherent retreat odds or that have earned promotions that give them retreat chances, then this line tells you the probability of your unit retreating. Units will only retreat if they are one hit away from being killed, and only when they are the attacker. The HP value presented on this line (Medium detail and higher) is the number of hitpoints the attacker would have if he were to retreat from the battle injured.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Defeat:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The odds of the attacker being killed by the defender. The XP the defender will earn is displayed, along with the average number of hitpoints the defender will have if he survives combat (Medium detail and higher).[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Detailed Attacker HP Outcomes:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]At the High and Everything, these values will be displayed directly under the battle outcomes representing the attacker surviving. For each number of hitpoints the attacker could possibly have, beside it you will find the probability of the unit exiting battle with that many hitpoints. There is also a coloured bar beside each outcome, to help visually identify the scope of the values. Note if there are retreat odds involved, the lowest HP value for the attacker will include the probability of retreat in its odds. Note the sum of all the HP outcomes should be the same as the odds of the attacker surviving.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Detailed Defender HP Outcomes:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Much the same as Attacker HP Outcomes, except for the defender. Note the sum of all these values should be the odds of the defender surviving.[PARAGRAPH:2]Attacker/Defender damager per hit, number of hits required, odds of hits and CombatRatio: A lot of data is displayed on this line. The first two values are the amount of HP damage each of the attacker and defender (respectively) will cause per hit. Then after that, the number of hits required by each combatant are displayed. In green, is the number of hits required by the attacker to kill the defender or to force the attacker's withdrawal due to a combat limit. In red is the number of hits required for the defender to make to either kill the attacker or to make him retreat. Next, the odds displayed in green are the odds of the attacker for making a hit in each combat round. The defender's odds are just 100% minus this number. Finally on this line is the important value called the CombatRatio or simply R. This value is equal to the attacker's modified combat strength divided by the defender's modified combat strength. This number is important for many reasons - one being that it determines how many XP the attacker and defender can earn from combat. The value R takes both injured units and all combat related modifiers into account (e.g. promotions and defense bonuses).[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Average HP: (High detail an above)[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]This line simply gives the average hitpoints for each combatant after battle. Unlike the averages presented earlier, these averages include the possibility of the unit dying, so they better reflect the overall outcome of battle.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unharmed:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]These odds are very simple. They are the odds of the attacker/defender exiting combat without taking a single hit i.e. unharmed. Units that are already injured are counted as winning unharmed if they don't take damage during the battle.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unrouneded XP:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]These values are shown at Everything detail only. These values are rounded down to the nearest whole number, and then forced to be within 1 and 10, to give the actual XP that can be earned by each combatant for killing their opponent.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]XP range:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]This line is only shown at Everything detail, and it crams a lot of information on one line. In the middle, it presents the CombatRatio i.e. the R value, and the XP it corresponds to. On either side of it, the CombatRatios that would lead to different number of XP earned are shown. If you increase the value of R (for example, by taking a Combat promotion) then tipping it over the next value will cause your XP earned to drop by 1 point.

TEXT.English: Advanced Espionage adds a slew of new espionage missions for your spies to preform and cause havoc with. Also, Advanced Espionage scales all missions damage with gamespeed, so the effects of the missions are more pronounced on slower speeds, and less noticable on faster speeds.[NEWLINE][H1]New Missions:[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Plant Nuclear Device[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Causes a thermo-nuclear detonation in the city it is preformed in. May cause extreme loss of life, destruction of city infrastructure, spread radioactive and damaging fallout, and may trigger war if the spy apprehended too late.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Disable City Powergrid[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Causes a complete power failure in the city for several turns. Any buildings in the city that use or require power to operate will cease to function; especially crippling late-game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Aid Rebel Factions[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gives the rebel factions in the city support and aid, and shifts public opinion to strongly favor the rebels. Note: Only active for games with Revolutions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]National Anarchy[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Causes the nation to enter anarchy for several turns; crippling all cities abilites to produce buildings or units, as well as stopping growth, research, income, and other nessecary services.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Stage Anti-War Protest[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Stages an anti-war protest, which can heavily increases the war weariness in the city the protest is held in.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bribe City[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pays the city governor a large of sum of money to switch the cities national alliegence to your empire. Will heavily damage the relations with the former owner.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Sabatoge Research[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ruins all research progress on the players current research.
TEXT.French: Espionnage Avancé ajoute de nouvelles missions d'espionnage et les effets associés. Cette option permet également d'adapter les effets des missions en fonction de la vitesse de la partie.[NEWLINE][H1]Nouvelles Missions:[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]ImPlanter un engin Nucléaire[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Provoque une détonation thermo-nucléaire dans la Ville, causant des dégâts immense pour la population, les bâtimnts, les terrains alentours, et peut déclencher une guerre si l'Espion est capturé.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Désactiver l'Alimentation electrique[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provoque un Black-Out électrique: tous les bâtiments nécessitant de l'énergie cessent de fonctionner temporairement.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Aide aux factions Rebelles[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Donne aux rebelles de la Ville un soutien important, et déplace l'opinion publique en faveurs de ceux-ci. Note: uniquement activé avec l'Option Revolution.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Anarchie Nationale[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provoque un effondrement du système de gouvernance et plonge la nation dans l'Anarchie pour quelques tours.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Manifestations pacifistes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Augmente de manière significative le mécontentement lié à la Guerre.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Corrompre les Dirigeants[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Le Gouverneur de la Ville reçoit une somme importante d'argent pour changer le sentiemnt d'appartenance nationale vers votre Empire. Entraîne une déterioration des relations diplomatiques.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Sabotage de la Recherche[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ruine les progrès de la recherche en cours.
TEXT.German: Diese Modifikation erweitert das Spionagesystem um eine Menge neuer Missionen, mit denen deine Spione für Chaos und Verwüstungen sorgen können. Außerdem wird der angerichtete Schaden an die Spielgeschwindigkeit angepasst, d.h. der Effekt ist in langsamen Spielen deutlich höher als in schnellen.[NEWLINE][H1]Neue Missionen:[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kernwaffe zünden[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Verursacht eine thermonukleare Detonation in der betreffenden Stadt, die einen Großteil der Bevölkerung umbringt, die Infrastruktur der Stadt zerstört, zerstörerischen radioaktiven Fallout entstehen lässt und natürlich eine Kriegserklärung heraufbeschwört, wenn der Spion festgenommen werden kann.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Stromversorgung unterbrechen[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Verursacht einen kompletten Stromausfall in der Stadt, der mehrere Runden andauert. Alle Gebäude, die auf Strom angewiesen sind, werden ihre Funktion einstellen, was besonders in späten Spielen verheerende Folgen haben kann.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rebellen unterstützen[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unterstützt die Rebellen in der Stadt und sorgt dafür, dass die Öffentlichkeit sich hinter die Rebellen stellt. Hinweis: Dies funktioniert nur in Spielen, in denen Revolutionen zugelassen sind.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Unruhen auslösen[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Stürzt die ganze Nation für mehrere Runden in Chaos, wodurch keine Gebäude oder Einheiten mehr produziert werden können und Wachstum, Forschung und Einkünfte zum Erliegen kommen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Antikriegsproteste inszenieren[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ein inszenierter Antikriegsprotest steigert die Kriegsmüdigkeit in der betreffenden Stadt enorm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Stadt bestechen[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Durch Zahlung einer großen Geldsumme kann der Bürgermeister einer Stadt dazu überredet werden, sich vom Heimatreich zu lösen und sich der Nation des Spions anzuschließen. Ein solcher Akt schadet den Beziehungen zum ehemaligen Besitzer der Stadt natürlich enorm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forschung sabotieren[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Zerstört die aktuellen Forschungsergebnisse, so dass der Spieler mit der Erforschung der betreffenden Technologie wieder von vorn beginnen muss.
TEXT.Italian: Spionaggio avanzato aggiunge un gran numero di missioni di spionaggio per le vostre spie. Inoltre, Spionaggio avanzato scala tutti i danni delle missioni con la velocità di gioco, quindi gli effetti delle missioni sono più pronunciati alle velocità inferiori, e meno evidenti alle velocità più elevate[NEWLINE][H1] Nuove missioni: [\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Dispositivo nucleare [\BOLD][NEWLINE]Provoca una detonazione termonucleare in una città. Può causare elevate perdite di vite, distruzione delle infrastrutture della città, si sviluppa fallout radioattivo e dannoso, e può causare una guerra se la spia viene fermata troppo tardi.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD] Disabilita rete elettrica cittadina [\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provoca un completo blackout in città per alcuni turni. Eventuali edifici della città che utilizzano o richiedono energia per funzionare cesseranno di funzionare; paralizzante nelle fasi avanzate della partita[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD] Aiuta fazioni ribelli [\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Fornisce alle fazioni ribelli in città sostegno e aiuto, e sposta l'opinione pubblica per favorire con forza i ribelli. Nota: Attivo solo per i giochi con Revolutions[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD] Anarchia Nazionale [\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Forza la nazione ad entrare in anarchia per alcuni turni; paralizza completamente tutte le citta[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD] Causa proteste contro la guerra [\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Causa una protesta anti-guerra, che può fortemente aumentare la stanchezza per la guerra in città[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD] Corrompi la Città [\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Paga il governatore della città una grande somma di di denaro per modificare l'affiliazione della città. Saranno pesantemente danneggiati i rapporti con il vecchio proprietario.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD] Sabota ricerca [\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rovina ogni progresso della ricerca in corso al giocatore bersaglio.
Spionaggio avanzato

TEXT.English: This component is a tool, you decide when you want to activate it and for how long. Press [BOLD]Ctrl-Shift-X[\BOLD] to open the AIAutoPlay Chooser window, select a number of turns to auto play and select Full Automation from the drop down menu (or no automation). There is a new feature to have the AI only move your units. At the start of your turn, change whatever you want or move a couple units, then press [BOLD]Ctrl-Shift-M[\BOLD] to have the AI do the rest of that turn. You can also cancel automation by pressing [BOLD]Ctrl-Shift-X[\BOLD] again, but only when there are no popups open. To help with that, there is a config option to block some standard game popups.[PARAGRAPH:2]In addition, there is a config option that will fortify all units fortified by the AI at the end of automation. Without this all units start active, although refortified units will not lose their defense percentage.[PARAGRAPH:2]Great for debugging or watching the behavior of the AI, as it shows you only what the AI can see. Also, if you want to skip certain sections of the game, or you're so close to winning but not quite there, let the AI play it for you! With many civs in the late game, auto play will still take a while but you won't have to do anything... it will basically take (number of turns)x(in between turn lag + a little bit) to go through the turns.
TEXT.French: Ce omposant est un outil permettant de donner à l'IA votre civilisation pour un certain nombre de tours. Appuyer sur [BOLD]Ctrl-Shift-X[\BOLD] pour ouvrir la fenêtre AIAutoPlay, Sélectionnez le nombre de tours à automatiser et le type d'automatisme (Totale pour pas d'automatisation). Il y a également une nouvelle fonctionnalité où l'IA va uniquement déplacer les unités. Commencez le tour, effectuez les changements ou actions que vous souhaitez, puis appuyez sur [BOLD]Ctrl-Shift-M[\BOLD] et l'IA se chargera de terminer le tour. Vous pouvez aussi annuler l'automatisation en pressant à nouveau [BOLD]Ctrl-Shift-X[\BOLD], mais uniquement lorsqu'il n'y a pas de fenêtre active.[PARAGRAPH:2]En supplément, il y a une option de configuration permettant de fortifier toutes les unités fortifiées par l'IA à la fin de l'automatisation. Sans cela, toutes les unités seront actives.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pratique pour les débuggage, ou pour observer le comportement de l'IA, ou pour vous épargner les quelques tours vous séparant d'une victoire évidente ou pour esquiver des sections du jeu trop ennuyeuses.

TEXT.English: There are five different air-bombing missions for air units. "Airbomb defenses" allows you to bombard plot improvements or city defense percentage. "Airbomb buildings" allows you to attempt to destroy one of the city's buildings. "Airbomb Factories" allows you to attempt to destroy one of the city's production buildings. "Port airbomb" allows you to attempt to damage a ship in the port, with a chance to sink her. "Strategic Airbomb" allows you to attempt to damage the current production project of the city. The airbomb missions are all subject to air interceptions.
TEXT.German: Es gibt 5 verschiedene Luftbombardierungen für Flugeinheiten. "Luftbombardierung Verteidigungen" erlaubt die Bombardierung von Geländemodernisierungen oder von Stadtverteigungswerten. "Luftbombardierung Gebäude" erlaubt den Versuch Gebäude in der Stadt zu zerstören. "Luftbombardierung Fabriken" erlaubt den Versuch gezielt die Produktionsanlagen einer Stadt zu zerstören. "PLuftbombardierung Häfen" erlaubt den Versuch ein Schiff im Hafen, mit einer gewissen Wahrscheinlichkeit es zu versenken, zu bombardieren. "Strategische Luftbombardierung" erlaubt den Versuch, die gegenwärtige Produktion der Stadt zu beschädigen. Alle Luftbombardierungen sind durch Abfangmissionen gefährdet
TEXT.Italian: Esistono cinque differenti missioni di bombardamento aereo. "Bombarda difese" consente di colpire caselle con miglioramenti o danneggiare difese cittadine. "Bombarda edifici" consente di provare a distruggere uno degli edifici cittadini. "Bombarda fabbriche" consente di provare a distruggere uno degli edifici produttivi della città. "Bombarda porto" consente di provare a distruggere una delle navi in porto, con la probabilità di affondarla. "Bombardamento strategico" consente di provare a danneggiare la produzione cittadina in corso. Queste missioni rischiano tutte l'intercettazione aerea.
Missioni di bombardamento
Combattimento aereo

TEXT.English: First seeing widespread military use in World War I as unarmed reconnaissance vehicles, over the next half-century aircraft would become the most versatile and powerful part of the modern army. Indeed, as recent events have shown, a military with air superiority can now cripple opposing ground forces before the first infantryman or armored vehicle ever sees an enemy soldier.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are two different categories of air units in Civilization IV: rotary-wing aircraft and fixed-wing aircraft.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Rotary Wing Aircraft[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_GUNSHIP]Gunships[\LINK] are heavily armed and armored helicopters. These powerful modern units are especially adept at destroying enemy tanks and vehicles.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Gunship Movement:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Gunships move like other land units, except that they pay 1 Movement Point to enter all land spaces, including peaks (which are impassable to other land units). Gunships cannot enter water spaces except when carried aboard a [LINK=UNIT_TRANSPORT]naval transport[\LINK] unit.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Gunship Combat:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Gunships fight like any other land unit: if it moves into a space containing an enemy unit, it attacks that unit. If an enemy unit moves into its space, it attacks the gunship.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Fixed Wing Aircraft[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]There are two categories of fixed-wing aircraft in the game: fighters and bombers.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Fighters:[\BOLD] Fighters are proficient at attacking enemy naval units - they can attack land units as well - and intercepting enemy fighters. Further, fighters can be based on [LINK=UNIT_CARRIER]aircraft carriers[\LINK]. Fighter-types include the aptly-named [LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]Fighter[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_JET_FIGHTER]Jet Fighter[\LINK] units.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombers:[\BOLD] Bombers are useful for [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombarding[\LINK] enemy cities and tile improvements. Further, bombers have a powerful attack against enemy land units. They can attack naval units, as well, but they are less effective when doing so. Bombers cannot be based on aircraft carriers. Bomber units include [LINK=UNIT_BOMBER]Bombers[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_STEALTH_BOMBER]Stealth Bombers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Fixed-Wing Aircraft Movement[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Fixed-wing aircraft are based in cities (or aboard aircraft carriers for fighters). They cannot begin or end a turn elsewhere. Fighters and bombers can "rebase" to another city (or carrier) during their turn. The city can be anywhere on the map, but it must be owned by you or by a civilization you have an [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Open Borders[\LINK] agreement with. If an aircraft rebases, it can do nothing else during that turn.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Fixed-Wing Missions[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When not rebasing, fixed-wing aircraft can perform a variety of different missions. Each aircraft can perform only one mission per turn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Mission Range:[\BOLD] Each fixed-wing air unit has a "mission range" rating. An aircraft can perform missions in any space within this range.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Air Strike:[\BOLD] A fixed-wing unit can be ordered to attack any ground unit within its range.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Recon:[\BOLD] An aircraft can be ordered to perform a recon mission. Click on a space within the unit's range and all units/improvements for the number of spaces equal to half of the units movement will be revealed.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Air Bomb:[\BOLD] Air units can be ordered to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombard[\LINK] enemy city fortifications and tile improvements within their mission range.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Intercept:[\BOLD] Fighter units can be ordered on "intercept" missions. They then have a chance to attack any enemy air units that try enter their mission range.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Ground Unit Interception of Aircraft[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Some ground units - [LINK=UNIT_SAM_INFANTRY]SAM Infantry[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_MECHANIZED_INFANTRY]Mechanized Infantry[\LINK], to name two - have a chance of intercepting enemy air units when the air units attack their square OR an adjacent square.
TEXT.French: L'aviation militaire date de la Première Guerre mondiale, où des avions non armés menaient des missions de reconnaissance. Au cours des dernières décennies, elle est devenue l'élément le plus polyvalent et le plus puissant des armées modernes. Une armée ayant la supériorité aérienne peut paralyser les forces terrestres ennemies avant même le début de la bataille.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il y a dans Civilization IV deux types d'unités aériennes, les aéronefs à voilure tournante, et les aéronefs à voilure fixe.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Aéronefs à voilure tournante[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]L'[LINK=UNIT_GUNSHIP]hélicoptère de combat[\LINK] est un hélicoptère lourdement armé et blindé. Cette puissante unité moderne est très efficace contre les chars et les véhicules ennemis.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Déplacement des hélicoptères:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]L'hélicoptère se déplace comme une unité terrestre, mais il dépense 1 point de mouvement quel que soit le type de terrain, même les sommets (infranchissables pour une unité terrestre). Il ne peut entrer sur un espace maritime sauf s'il se trouve à bord d'un [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]bateau de transport[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Combat des hélicoptères:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]L'hélicoptère se bat comme les autres unités terrestres. S'il pénètre un espace occupé par une unité ennemie, il l'attaque. Si une unité ennemie pénètre dans l'espace qu'il occupe, elle l'attaque.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Aéronefs à voilure fixe[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Il existe deux catégories d'avions: les chasseurs et les bombardiers.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Chasseur:[\BOLD] le chasseur est très efficace contre les unités navales (mais il peut aussi attaquer des unités terrestres), et contre les chasseurs ennemis. De plus, un chasseur peut être basé sur un [LINK=UNIT_CARRIER]porte-avions[\LINK]. Il y a deux types de chasseurs, le [LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]chasseur[\LINK] et le [LINK=UNIT_JET_FIGHTER]chasseur à réaction[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombardiers:[\BOLD] il peut [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombarder[\LINK] les villes ennemies. Il est aussi très puissant contre les unités terrestres. En revanche, son efficacité est limitée contre les unités navales. Le bombardier peut aussi détruire des améliorations. Un bombardier ne peut être basé sur un porte-avions. Il y a deux types de bombardiers, les [LINK=UNIT_BOMBER]bombardiers[\LINK] et les [LINK=UNIT_STEALTH_BOMBER]bombardiers furtifs.[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Déplacement des avions[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Un avion est basé dans une ville (ou sur un porte-avion pour un chasseur). Il doit y débuter et y finir son tour. Un avion peut changer de base (ville ou porte-avions) durant son tour. La ville peut se trouver n'importe où sur la carte, mais doit vous appartenir, ou dépendre d'une civilisation avec laquelle vous avez un accord d'[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]ouverture des frontières[\LINK]. Quand un avion change de base, il ne peut rien faire d'autre durant ce tour.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Missions des avions[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Quand il ne change pas de base, un avion peut effectuer différents types de missions, mais une seule par tour.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Rayon d'action:[\BOLD] chaque unité aérienne dispose d'un rayon d'action limité. Elle peut accomplir une mission sur n'importe quel espace situé dans son rayon d'action.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Attaque:[\BOLD] un avion peut attaquer n'importe quel espace situé dans son rayon d'action occupé par l'ennemi.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Reconnaissance:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Un avion peut effectuer une mission de reconnaissance. Cliquez sur un espace situé dans son rayon d'action, et toutes les unités/améliorations qui se trouvent à moins de? espaces apparaîtront.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombardement:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Un bombardier peut [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombarder[\LINK] les fortifications des villes ennemies situées dans son rayon d'action.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Interception:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Un chasseur peut mener une mission d'"interception". Il peut alors attaquer toute unité aérienne ennemie qui entre dans son rayon d'action.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Interception d'avion par une unité terrestre[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Certaines unités terrestres, comme l'[LINK=UNIT_SAM_INFANTRY]infanterie antiaérienne[\LINK] et l'[LINK=UNIT_MECHANIZED_INFANTRY]infanterie mécanisée[\LINK], peuvent intercepter une unité aérienne ennemie qui attaque leur espace ou un espace adjacent.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Aéroport[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Toutes les villes peuvent produire des unités aériennes, mais si elles disposent d'un aéroport, l'unité débutera avec 4 [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]points d'expérience[\LINK].
TEXT.German: Lufteinheiten wurden erstmals während des 1. Weltkriegs als unbewaffnete Aufklärer in größerem Maßstab eingesetzt. Heute ist das Flugzeug die vielseitigste und effektivste Waffe moderner Armeen. Wie die jüngsten Ereignisse gezeigt haben, kann eine überlegene Luftwaffe feindliche Verbände entscheidend schwächen, bevor Bodentruppen in das Zielgebiet vorrücken.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV gibt es folgende Lufteinheiten: Drehflügler und Starrflügler.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Drehflügler[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_GUNSHIP]Kampfhubschrauber[\LINK] sind schwer gepanzerte und bewaffnete Helikopter, die auf die Zerstörung feindlicher Panzer und Fahrzeuge spezialisiert sind.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Fortbewegung der Kampfhubschrauber[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Kampfhubschrauber bewegen sich wie Landeinheiten. Allerdings kostet sie die Überquerung von Hügeln und anderer für Bodentruppen unpassierbarer Gebiete einen zusätzlichen Fortbewegungspunkt. Kampfhubschrauber können keine Gewässer überqueren, es sei denn, sie sind auf Flugzeugträgern oder anderen [LINK=UNIT_TRANSPORT]Transportschiffen[\LINK] stationiert.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Kampfweise des Kampfhubschraubers[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Kampfhubschrauber kämpfen wie Landeinheiten. Stoßen sie auf ein Geländefeld mit einer feindlichen Einheit, greifen sie diese an. Betritt eine andere feindliche Einheit das Geländefeld, attackiert diese die Kampfhubschrauber.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Starrflügler[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Im Spiel erwarten Sie folgende Starrflügler: Jäger und Bomber.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Jäger:[\BOLD] Jäger eignen sich gleichermaßen für Angriffe auf Ziele zu Wasser, an Land und in der Luft und können auf [LINK=UNIT_CARRIER]Flugzeugträgern[\LINK] stationiert werden. In die Kategorie "Jäger" fallen [LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]Jagdflugzeug[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_JET_FIGHTER]Kampfjet[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bomber:[\BOLD] Bomber werden bei der [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Bombardierung[\LINK] feindlicher Städte, Gebäude oder Bodentruppen eingesetzt. Im Kampf gegen seegestützte Einheiten sind sie allerdings nur bedingt effektiv. Darüber hinaus können sie nicht auf Flugzeugträgern stationiert werden. Zur Kategorie "Bomber" gehören [LINK=UNIT_BOMBER]Bomber[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_STEALTH_BOMBER]Tarnkappenbomber[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Fortbewegung der Starrflügler[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Starrflügler sind in Städten stationiert (Jäger können auch an Bord eines Flugzeugträgers stationiert werden) und müssen stets zu ihrer Ausgangsbasis zurückkehren. Jäger und Bomber können in andere Städte (oder auf andere Träger) verlegt werden. Die Position der Stadt spielt keine Rolle, allerdings muss Sie Ihnen oder einer Zivilisation gehören, mit der Sie ein Abkommen über [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Offene Grenzen[\LINK] geschlossen haben. Wird ein Flugzeug verlegt, kann es in der aktuellen Runde nicht mehr in das Spiel eingreifen.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Einsatzgebiete der Starrflügler[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Starrflügler können verschiedene Missionen ausführen. Jedes Flugzeug kann pro Runde nur einen Auftrag erledigen.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Reichweite:[\BOLD] Starrflügler haben eine vorgegebene Reichweite, innerhalb der sie Einsätze fliegen können.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Angriff:[\BOLD] Starrflügler können besetzte Geländefelder innerhalb ihrer Reichweite attackieren.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Aufklärung:[\BOLD] ] Setzen Sie Ihre Flugzeuge als Aufklärungseinheiten ein. Klicken Sie dazu einfach auf ein Geländefeld innerhalb der Reichweite der Einheit. Nun werden alle Einheiten/Gebäude in einem bestimmten Umkreis angezeigt.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombardieren:[\BOLD] Befehlen Sie einer Bombereinheit, feindliche Städte in Reichweite zu [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombardieren[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Abfangen:[\BOLD] Jäger können feindliche Maschinen in Reichweite abfangen.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Abschuss mit Landeinheiten[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Einige Bodentruppen, wie die [LINK=UNIT_SAM_INFANTRY]SAM-Infanterie[\LINK] und die [LINK=UNIT_MECHANIZED_INFANTRY]Schützenpanzer[\LINK], können feindliche Flugzeuge abschießen, wenn diese ihr Geländefeld ODER ein angrenzendes Geländefeld attackieren.
TEXT.Italian: Sono state utilizzate diffusamente per la prima volta nel corso della Prima Guerra Mondiale come veicoli da ricognizione privi di armi; nei cinquant'anni successivi sono diventate una delle componenti più versatili e potenti degli eserciti moderni. In effetti, come hanno mostrato gli eventi più recenti, un esercito con superiorità aerea è in grado di indebolire le forze di terra nemiche prima ancora che una singola unità di fanteria o un mezzo corazzato possano vedere un soldato nemico.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV esistono due diverse categorie di unità aeree, quelle ad ala fissa e quelle ad ala rotante.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Velivoli ad ala rotante[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_GUNSHIP]Gli elicotteri da guerra[\LINK] sono mezzi corazzati e con un potente arsenale; queste unità sono moderne, molto potenti, e particolarmente indicate per la distruzione di carri armati e veicoli nemici.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Movimento degli elicotteri da guerra:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Gli elicotteri da guerra si muovono come le altre unità di terra, a eccezione del fatto che usano 1 PM per entrare nelle zone terrestri, comprese le montagne (che non possono essere attraversate da altre unità di terra). Gli elicotteri da guerra non possono entrare nelle zone di acqua ad eccezione di quelli caricati a bordo di unità per il [LINK=UNIT_TRANSPORT]trasporto navale[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Combattimento degli elicotteri da guerra:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Un elicottero da guerra combatte come ogni altra unità di terra: se entra in uno spazio che contiene un'unità nemica, la attacca. Se un'unità nemica entra nel suo spazio, essa attacca l'elicottero.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Velivoli ad ala fissa[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Nel gioco esistono due categorie di velivoli ad ala fissa, i caccia e i bombardieri.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Caccia:[\BOLD] sono molto efficaci nell'attacco di unità navali nemiche - ma possono anche colpire unità terrestri - e nell'intercettazione di caccia nemici. Inoltre, i caccia possono stazionare sulle [LINK=UNIT_CARRIER]portaerei[\LINK]. I diversi tipi di caccia comprendono i [LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]caccia[\LINK] stessi e i [LINK=UNIT_JET_FIGHTER]jet da combattimento[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombardieri:[\BOLD] sono utili per [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombardare[\LINK] le città nemiche e i miglioramenti delle caselle. Inoltre, possono attaccare le unità di terra ostili e anche le unità navali, ma in questo caso i risultati sono meno efficaci. I bombardieri non possono essere caricati sulle portaerei. Le unità dei bombardieri comprendono i [LINK=UNIT_BOMBER]bombardieri[\LINK] e i [LINK=UNIT_STEALTH_BOMBER]bombardieri invisibili[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:2].[H2]Movimento dei velivoli ad ala fissa[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Gli aerei ad ala fissa possono essere dislocati nelle città oppure a bordo di portaerei, nel caso dei caccia. Non possono iniziare o terminare un turno da nessun'altra parte. Nel corso del loro turno, caccia e bombardieri possono essere assegnati a una base che si trova in un'altra città (o portaerei). La città può trovarsi in qualunque punto della mappa, ma deve essere in tuo possesso o in quello di una civiltà con la quale hai un accordo di [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]diritto di passaggio[\LINK]. Se un aereo viene assegnato a una nuova base, non può fare altro per il resto del turno.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Missioni dei velivoli ad ala fissa[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Se non sono stati assegnati a una nuova base, i velivoli ad ala fissa possono compiere svariate missioni. Ogni aereo può compiere una sola missione per turno.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Raggio d'azione:[\BOLD] ogni unità aerea ad ala fissa ha un raggio d'azione prestabilito: al suo interno, un aereo può compiere missioni in qualsiasi zona.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Attacco aereo:[\BOLD] a un'unità ad ala fissa può essere ordinato l'attacco di una qualsiasi unità di terra nemica (che si trovi all'interno del suo raggio d'azione).[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Ricognizione:[\BOLD] un aereo può effettuare missioni di ricognizione. Clicca su una casella contenuta nel suo raggio d'azione, e verranno mostrate tutte le unità e i miglioramenti presenti al suo interno.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombardamento aereo:[\BOLD] le unità aeree possono ricevere l'ordine di [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombardare[\LINK] fortificazioni delle città nemiche e i miglioramenti delle caselle all'interno del proprio raggio d'azione.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Intercettazione:[\BOLD] i caccia possono intraprendere missioni di intercettazione, con la possibilità di attaccare qualsiasi unità nemica che cerchi di entrare nel loro raggio d'azione.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Intercettazione di aerei da parte delle unità di terra[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Alcune unità di terra - [LINK=UNIT_SAM_INFANTRY]Fanteria con missili terra-aria[\LINK] e [LINK=UNIT_MECHANIZED_INFANTRY]fanteria meccanizzata[\LINK], per citarne un paio - hanno la possibilità di intercettare unità aeree nemiche quando attaccano una loro casella OPPURE una a essa adiacente.
TEXT.Spanish: El uso militar de las aeronaves se empezó a ver en la Primera Guerra Mundial como vehículos desarmados de reconocimiento. Durante el medio siglo siguiente las aeronaves se convertirían en la parte más versátil y poderosa del ejército moderno. En efecto, como han demostrado los acontecimientos recientes, unas fuerzas armadas con superioridad aérea pueden inutilizar a las fuerzas terrestres antes de que el primer soldado de infantería o vehículo blindado llegue tan siquiera a ver al enemigo.[PARAGRAPH:2]En Civilization IV hay dos categorías diferentes para las unidades aéreas: las aeronaves de ala rotatoria y las aeronaves de ala fija.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Aeronaves de ala rotatoria[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Los [LINK=UNIT_GUNSHIP]helicópteros de combate[\LINK] son helicópteros con armamento y blindaje pesados. Estas poderosas unidades modernas son especialmente adecuadas para destruir tanques y vehículos enemigos.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Movimiento del helicóptero de combate:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Los helicópteros de combate se mueven como las unidades terrestres, excepto en que pagan 1 punto de movimiento por entrar en todas las casillas terrestres, incluyendo picos (que son infranqueables para las unidades terrestres). Los helicópteros de combate no pueden entrar en casillas acuáticas excepto cuando van a bordo de una unidad de [LINK=UNIT_TRANSPORT]transporte naval[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Combate del helicóptero de combate:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Este helicóptero combate como cualquier unidad terrestre: si entra en una casilla que contenga una unidad enemiga, la atacará. Si una unidad enemiga entra en la casilla que ocupa el helicóptero de combate, lo atacará.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Aeronaves de ala fija[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]En el juego hay dos categorías de aeronaves de ala fija: los cazas y los bombarderos.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Cazas:[\BOLD] Los cazas son adecuados para atacar a las unidades navales enemigas (aunque también pueden atacar a las terrestres) y para interceptar a los cazas enemigos. Además, pueden tener su base en [LINK=UNIT_CARRIER]portaaviones[\LINK]. Los tipos de cazas incluyen las unidades de [LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]caza[\LINK] en sentido estricto y las de [LINK=UNIT_JET_FIGHTER]caza a reacción[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombarderos:[\BOLD] Los bombarderos son útiles para [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombardear[\LINK] las ciudades enemigas y las mejoras de las casillas. Además, tienen un ataque muy potente contra las unidades terrestres enemigas. También pueden atacar a las unidades navales (pero con menor eficacia) Los bombarderos no pueden tener su base en los portaaviones. Las unidades de bombarderos incluyen los [LINK=UNIT_BOMBER]bombarderos[\LINK] y los [LINK=UNIT_STEALTH_BOMBER]bombarderos invisibles[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Movimiento de las aeronaves de ala fija[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Las aeronaves de ala fija tienen su base en las ciudades (o a bordo de los portaaviones, en el caso de los cazas). No pueden empezar ni terminar el turno en ningún otro sitio. Los cazas y bombarderos pueden "Cambiar de base" y reubicarse en otra ciudad (o portaaviones) durante el turno. La ciudad puede estar en cualquier lugar del mapa, pero ha de ser tuya o de una civilización con la que tengas un acuerdo de [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]apertura de fronteras[\LINK]. Si una aeronave cambia de base, no podrá hacer nada más en ese turno.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Misiones de aeronaves de ala fija[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando no está cambiando de base, una aeronave de ala fija puede llevar a cabo una gran variedad de misiones, aunque solo una por turno.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Alcance de la misión:[\BOLD] Cada unidad de ala fija tiene un nivel de "Alcance de la misión", y puede llevar a cabo misiones en cualquier casilla que esté dentro de ese alcance.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Ataque aéreo:[\BOLD] A una unidad de ala fija se le puede ordenar que ataque a cualquier unidad terrestre que esté dentro de su alcance.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Reconocimiento:[\BOLD] A una unidad de ala fija se le puede ordenar que realice una misión de reconocimiento. Haz clic en una casilla dentro del alcance de la unidad y se mostrarán todas las unidades/mejoras que haya dentro del radio de alcance del reconocimiento.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Bombardeo aéreo:[\BOLD] A las unidades aéreas se les puede ordenar que [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]bombardeen[\LINK] las fortificaciones de las ciudades enemigas y las mejoras de casillas que estén dentro de su alcance.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Intercepción:[\BOLD] A las unidades de cazas se les pueden encargar misiones de "Intercepción", en las que tendrán la posibilidad de atacar a cualquier unidad aérea enemiga que intente entrar en el alcance de su misión.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Intercepción de aeronaves por parte de las unidades terrestres[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Algunas unidades terrestres (la [LINK=UNIT_SAM_INFANTRY]infantería con misiles tierra-aire[\LINK] y la [LINK=UNIT_MECHANIZED_INFANTRY]infantería mecanizada[\LINK], por citar dos) tienen la posibilidad de interceptar a las unidades aéreas enemigas cuando éstas ataquen su casilla o una adyacente.

TEXT.Italian: Tutte le caselle (%d1)

TEXT.English: [BOLD]This concept is wrong for Caveman2Cosmos. See [LINK=CONCEPT_SUBDUED_ANIMALS]C2C Concepts - Subdued Animals[\LINK] for the correct information.[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]At the start of a game of Civilization IV, predatory animals may be found roaming about the world. These animals will attack any units they encounter; unarmed settlers and workers are especially at risk. Animals can be fought and destroyed just like any other unit in the game. Animals will not appear in or move into areas within a [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]National Border[\LINK]; they will gradually disappear as more and more of the world is claimed.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Dieses Konzept wurde durch Caveman2Cosmos komplett überholt. Unter dem [LINK=CONCEPT_SUBDUED_ANIMALS]C2C-Konzept - Gezähmte Tiere[\LINK] sind die aktualisierten Informationen zu finden.[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]In der steinzeitlichen Umgebung zu Anfang einer Standardpartie durchstreifen verschiedenste Tiere die Erde. Raubtiere greifen nahezu alle Einheiten an, auf die sie stoßen. Besonders gefährdet sind unbewaffnete Siedler und Arbeitstrupps. Tiere können wie jede andere Einheit im Spiel bekämpft und vernichtet werden. Tiere meiden zivilisierte Gebiete, die durch eine [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Staatsgrenze[\LINK] am Bildschirm angezeigt werden. Je mehr die zivilisierte Welt sich ausbreitet, desto weniger Gebiete stehen Tieren zur Verfügung, bis diese mangels Lebensraum schließlich gänzlich verschwinden.
TEXT.Spanish: [BOLD]Este concepto no es válido en Caveman2Cosmos. Véase [LINK=CONCEPT_SUBDUED_ANIMALS]Conceptos de C2C - Doma de animales[\LINK] para ver la información correcta.[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Al empezar el juego Civilization IV, se pueden encontrar depredadores pululando por el mundo. Estos animales atacarán a cualquier unidad que encuentren; corren especial peligro los colonos y trabajadores que van desarmados. Se puede combatir a los animales y destruirlos como si fueran cualquier otra unidad del juego. Los animales no aparecerán tras la [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontera de una nación[\LINK] ni la cruzarán e irán desapareciendo gradualmente a medida que se conquisten más partes del mundo.

TEXT.Spanish: El Palacio Apostólico / Las Naciones Unidas

TEXT.English: Barbarians can appear as individual units or as cities.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Barbarian Units[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Barbarian units are generated randomly in map spaces that no non-barbarian units can see. Barbarians may attack any units and cities they encounter. They in turn can be attacked and destroyed like any other units in the game. Barbarian units will not be generated within a [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]nation's borders[\LINK], but they can move into such territory at will. This is in contrast to [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Animals[\LINK], who will not enter the territory of a civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Barbarian Cities[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Occasionally Barbarians will settle down and form cities. These cities are like any other city in the game: the Barbarians can build [LINK=BUILDING_WALLS]walls[\LINK] and other fortifications; they can fill the cities with defending units; they can even build [LINK=UNIT_WORKER]Workers[\LINK] to improve the territory around their cities.[PARAGRAPH:2]Barbarian cities can be attacked, conquered or destroyed like any other city in the game.
TEXT.French: Les barbares interviennent en tant qu'unités isolées ou en tant que villes.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Unités barbares[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Les unités barbares sont générées aléatoirement sur des parties de la carte invisibles par les unités non-barbares. Les barbares sont susceptibles d'attaquer n'importe quelle unité ou ville qu'ils rencontrent. Ils peuvent à leur tour être attaqués et détruits comme n'importe quelle unité du jeu. Les unités barbares ne sont jamais générées à l'intérieur des [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontières d'une nation[\LINK], mais elles peuvent les franchir, contrairement aux [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]animaux[\LINK], qui ne pénètrent pas sur le territoire d'une civilisation.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Villes barbares[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Ces unités peuvent à l'occasion se fixer et fonder une ville. Ces cités sont comme toutes les autres, leurs habitants peuvent y construire des [LINK=WALLS]murailles[\LINK] ou autres fortifications. Ils peuvent y fixer des garnisons, et même entraîner des [LINK=UNIT_WORKER]ouvriers[\LINK] pour améliorer les terrains avoisinants.[PARAGRAPH:2]On peut attaquer, conquérir ou détruire les villes barbares, comme n'importe quelle autre ville du jeu.
TEXT.German: Barbaren treten als Einzeleinheiten oder in Städten auf.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Einheiten[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Barbareneinheiten entstehen auf Geländefeldern, die zivilisierte Einheiten nicht einsehen können. Barbaren attackieren feindliche Einheiten und Städte, können allerdings ebenfalls attackiert und vernichtet werden. Barbaren werden nicht innerhalb der [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK] eines Landes erzeugt, können in diese (im Gegensatz zu [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Tieren[\LINK]) aber einfallen. Tiere dringen nicht in das Staatsgebiet einer Zivilisation ein.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Städte[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Gelegentlich werden Barbaren sesshaft und gründen Städte. Diese entsprechen den herkömmlichen Städten des Spiels. Barbaren errichten [LINK=BUILDING_WALLS]Stadtmauern[\LINK] und andere Befestigungsanlagen und sichern ihre Städte mit Truppen. [LINK=UNIT_WORKER]Arbeitstrupps[\LINK] ermöglichen ihnen den Ausbau ihrer Städte. Barbarenstädte können wie alle anderen Städte angegriffen, erobert und zerstört werden.
TEXT.Italian: I Barbari possono apparire casualmente con unità o città.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Le unità Barbare[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Le unità Barbare vengono generate a caso nelle caselle di mappa che nessuna unità può vedere; i Barbari possono attaccare qualsiasi unità o città sul loro cammino, ma possono essere affrontate o sconfitte come qualsiasi altra unità nel gioco. Le unità Barbare non possono apparire all'interno dei [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]confini della nazione[\LINK], ma possono muoversi in questi territori, al contrario degli [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]animali[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Le città Barbare[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Occasionalmente, i Barbari potranno fondare città, che sono esattamente come tutte le altre del gioco: i Barbari possono costruire le [LINK=BUILDING_WALLS]mura[\LINK] e altre fortificazioni, oltre a riempire le città di unità difensive; possono addirittura costruire dei [LINK=UNIT_WORKER]lavoratori[\LINK] per migliorare il territorio attorno alle loro città.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le città Barbare possono essere attaccate, conquistate o distrutte come tutte le altre presenti nel gioco.
TEXT.Spanish: Los bárbaros pueden aparecer como unidades sueltas o como ciudades.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Unidades bárbaras[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Las unidades bárbaras se generan al azar en casillas del mapa que no pueda ver ninguna unidad que no sea bárbara. Los bárbaros pueden atacar a todas las unidades y ciudades que encuentren, pero también pueden ser atacados y destruidos como cualquier otra unidad del juego. Las unidades bárbaras no se generarán dentro de las [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]fronteras de una nación[\LINK], pero pueden entrar en ellas a voluntad. Esto es a diferencia de los [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]animales[\LINK], que no entrarán en el territorio de una civilización.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Ciudades bárbaras[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]De vez en cuando, los bárbaros se asentarán y formarán ciudades. Esas ciudades son como cualquier otra del juego: los bárbaros pueden construir [LINK=BUILDING_WALLS]murallas[\LINK] y demás fortificaciones, llenarlas de unidades defensoras e incluso producir [LINK=UNIT_WORKER]trabajadores[\LINK] para mejorar el territorio circundante.[PARAGRAPH:2]Las ciudades bárbaras se pueden atacar, conquistar y destruir, como cualquier otra del juego.

TEXT.Italian: Modificatori (%D1%%)
Risorse

TEXT.English: The land that your civilization controls - that is, the land within its "borders" - is determined by the number and cultural strength of your cities. When you first construct a city, its borders usually extend to the squares directly adjacent to it; as the city's [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]cultural value[\LINK] grows, its borders extend to squares farther away, eventually merging with the borders of your other nearby cities.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Seeing Borders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Squares within each civilization's borders are lightly tinted different colors. [LINK=CONCEPT_BARBARIANS]Barbarian-controlled[\LINK] squares are tinted black. If unsure of a square's status, put your mouse on that square and look at the "pop-up help." [H2]Effects of Borders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Borders have a number of important effects. Your cities can draw sustenance only from spaces within your borders, and your workers can only [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]"improve"[\LINK] such squares as well (except for roads and railroads, which they can build anywhere). Your units heal faster within your own borders, more slowly in neutral (unclaimed) territory, and even slower when in foreign borders. Further, other civilizations' units (with a few exceptions) cannot enter your territory without declaring war, nor can you enter theirs. Barbarians can enter your territory, but animals cannot.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Clash of Borders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When you have a city near another civilization's city, the two will compete for [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]cultural control[\LINK] over the squares between them. Generally, if the square is equidistant from both cities, the city with the highest culture will have control over it. It is important to keep in mind that the earlier a city begins producing culture, the more difficult it will be for a rival city to dislodge the tiles it controls. Cities are not guaranteed to control a certain number of tiles; if one city's culture greatly exceeds the other's, its control may extend to squares closer to the other city and possibly to the squares directly adjacent to it. Since a city can draw sustenance only from squares within its cultural borders, this may greatly limit the city's growth and possibly lead to [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]starvation[\LINK] or even to the city switching sides and changing its allegiance to the encroaching civilization. See [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]culture[\LINK] for more details.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Capturing Enemy Cities[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When you capture an enemy city, that city must begin producing culture to expand its borders from square one, and this can only take place after [LINK=CONCEPT_RESISTANCE]"resistance"[\LINK] has ended in that city. It is not unusual for newly captured cities to have control of very few tiles until the conqueror begins producing culture in them.
TEXT.French: La terre que contrôle votre civilisation, c'est-à-dire la terre qui se trouve à l'intérieur de ses "frontières", est déterminée par le nombre de villes et leur influence culturelle. Quand vous fondez une ville, ses frontières se limitent généralement aux cases adjacentes. Au fur et à mesure qu'augmente la [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]valeur culturelle[\LINK] de la ville, ses limites s'étendent aux cases suivantes, pour se fondre finalement avec les frontières des villes voisines.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Voir les frontières[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]La couleur des cases qui se trouvent à l'intérieur des frontières d'une civilisation est légèrement différente. Les cases contrôlées par les [LINK=CONCEPT_BARBARIANS]barbares[\LINK] sont teintées de noir. Si vous avez un doute, placez la souris sur la case et regardez "la fenêtre d'aide". [H2]Effets des frontières[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Les frontières ont de nombreux effets sur une civilisation. Vos villes ne peuvent produire que sur les cases situées à l'intérieur de vos frontières, et vos ouvriers ne peuvent [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]"améliorer"[\LINK] que les terrains vous appartenant (sauf pour les routes et les voies de chemin de fer qu'ils peuvent construire n'importe où). Vos unités guérissent plus vite à l'intérieur des frontières, plus lentement sur les territoires neutres, et encore plus lentement sur les territoires étrangers. De plus, à quelques exceptions près, une unité ne peut pénétrer sur le territoire d'une civilisation sans lui avoir préalablement déclaré la guerre. Les barbares peuvent franchir les frontières, mais pas les animaux.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Conflit de frontières[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Quand deux villes appartenant à des civilisations différentes se trouvent à proximité l'une de l'autre, elles luttent pour asseoir leur [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]domination culturelle[\LINK] sur les cases situées entre elles. En règle générale, une case située à même distance des deux villes dépend de celle qui a la valeur culturelle la plus élevée. Il est donc important de comprendre que plus une ville développe tôt sa culture, plus il sera difficile pour une cité rivale de la déloger des cases qu'elle contrôle. Lorsque la valeur culturelle d'une ville excède largement celle d'une autre, son influence peut s'étendre jusqu'aux cases adjacentes à cette dernière. Sachant qu'une ville ne peut produire que sur les cases qu'elle contrôle, cela peut considérablement limiter sa croissance, voire la conduire à la [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]famine[\LINK] ou même la pousser à changer de camp et à prêter allégeance à la civilisation qui empiète sur son territoire. Pour plus de détails, voir la section [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]culture[\LINK].[H2]Capturer une ville ennemie[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Lorsque vous capturez une ville ennemie, celle-ci doit commencer à produire de la culture pour étendre ses frontières au-delà de la première case. Ceci n'est possible qu'à la fin de la [LINK=CONCEPT_RESISTANCE]"résistance"[\LINK] dans cette ville. Il est fréquent qu'une ville nouvellement conquise ne contrôle que peu de cases jusqu'à ce que son vainqueur commence à y générer de la culture.
TEXT.German: Das kontrollierte Hoheitsgebiet (also das Land innerhalb der "Grenzen") wird durch die Anzahl und kulturelle Macht der Städte bestimmt. Wenn Sie Ihre erste Stadt bauen, liegen auch die direkt daran angrenzenden Geländefelder innerhalb Ihrer Grenzen. Wächst der [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Kulturwert[\LINK] einer Stadt, weiten sich ihre Grenzen auf weiter entfernte Geländefelder aus, bis sie mit den Grenzen anderer Städte verschmelzen.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Sichtbare Grenzen[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Geländefelder innerhalb der einzelnen Zivilisationsgrenzen sind in verschiedenen Farben markiert. Von [LINK=CONCEPT_BARBARIANS]Barbaren[\LINK] kontrollierte Geländefelder sind schwarz. Möchten Sie sich über den Status eines Geländefelds informieren, bewegen Sie den Cursor über das Geländefeld und lesen Sie die Online-Hilfe.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Auswirkungen von Grenzen[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Grenzen wirken sich auf vielfältige Weise aus. Ihre Städte können nur auf Geländefeldern innerhalb ihrer Grenzen Nahrungsmittel anbauen. Arbeitstrupps können ebenfalls nur diese Geländefelder [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]verbessern[\LINK]. Nur Straßen und Schienenwege dürfen dagegen überall gebaut werden. Innerhalb der Grenzen Ihrer Zivilisation regeneriert sich die Gesundheit Ihrer Einheiten schneller. In neutralen und feindlichen Territorien dauert der Heilungsprozess deutlich länger. Darüber hinaus können andere Einheiten (mit wenigen Ausnahmen) Ihr Territorium nicht betreten, ohne Ihnen den Krieg zu erklären. Das gilt natürlich auch für Sie. Barbaren können Ihr Territorium betreten, Tiere nicht.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Grenzkonflikte[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Gründen Sie eine Stadt in der Nähe einer feindlichen Stadt, kämpfen beide Städte um die [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]kulturelle Kontrolle[\LINK] über die Geländefelder zwischen den Städten. Ist ein Geländefeld von beiden Städten gleich weit entfernt, wird es im Allgemeinen von der Stadt mit dem höheren Kulturwert kontrolliert. Je früher eine Stadt Kultur entwickelt, desto schwieriger wird es für eine rivalisierende Stadt, angrenzende Geländefelder zu übernehmen. Städte kontrollieren keine vorgegebene Zahl von Geländefeldern. Hat eine Stadt einen deutlich höheren Kulturwert, kann sie ihren Einflussbereich unter Umständen bis an die Grenze der anderen Stadt ausweiten. Da eine Stadt nur auf Geländefeldern innerhalb ihrer Grenzen Nahrungsmittel anbauen darf, kann dies das Wachstum der Stadt ernsthaft behindern. Im Extremfall kommt es zu einer [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Hungersnot[\LINK] oder Ihre Stadt wechselt die Seiten. Weitere Informationen dazu finden Sie im Abschnitt [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Kultur[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Eroberung von Städten[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Haben Sie eine feindliche Stadt erobert, müssen Sie ihren Kulturwert erhöhen, um ihren Einfluss auszuweiten. Dies ist allerdings erst möglich, nachdem Sie den [LINK=CONCEPT_RESISTANCE]Widerstand[\LINK] der Stadt gebrochen haben. Es ist daher nicht ungewöhnlich, dass eroberte Städte nur wenige Geländefelder kontrollieren, bis der Eroberer den Kulturwert der Stadt erhöht.
TEXT.Italian: Il territorio che si trova all'interno dei confini della tua civiltà è determinata dal numero e dalla forza culturale delle tue città. Quando costruisci per la prima volta una città, i suoi confini si estendono solitamente fino alle caselle immediatamente adiacenti a essa; man mano che aumenta il [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]valore culturale[\LINK] della città, i suoi confini si estendono di diverse caselle, fino a fondersi con i confini delle altre città vicine in tuo possesso.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Visualizzare i confini[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Le caselle all'interno dei confini di ogni civiltà sono colorate in maniera leggermente diversa. Le caselle [LINK=CONCEPT_BARBARIANS]controllate dai Barbari[\LINK] sono colorate di nero. Se non sei sicuro dello stato di una casella, posiziona su di essa il puntatore del mouse e leggi quanto dice la finestra a comparsa.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effetti dei confini[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]I confini hanno diversi importanti effetti sul gioco. Le tue città possono trarre sostentamento solo dalle aree all'interno dei loro confini, e i tuoi lavoratori possono [LINK=ICONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]"migliorare"[\LINK] solo quelle zone (ad eccezione di strade e ferrovie, che possono essere costruite ovunque). Le tue unità guariscono più rapidamente all'interno dei propri confini, più lentamente nei territori neutrali (non reclamati), e ancora più lentamente quando si trovano all'interno di territori stranieri. A questo si aggiunge il fatto che le unità delle altre civiltà (con alcune eccezioni) non possono entrare nel tuo territorio senza dichiarare guerra, e lo stesso dicasi quando cerchi di entrare nel loro. I Barbari possono entrare nel tuo territorio, ma non gli animali.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Scontro di confini[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Quando una città in tuo possesso è vicina a quella di un'altra civiltà, le due entreranno in competizione per il [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]controllo culturale[\LINK] nelle zone confinanti. In generale, se l'area è equidistante dalle due città, quella con il livello di cultura più alto ne assume il controllo. È importante ricordare che prima una città comincia a produrre cultura, più difficile risulterà per una città rivale toglierle le caselle che controlla. Non c'è garanzia che le città controllino un numero determinato di caselle: se la cultura di una città è di gran lunga superiore a quella di un'altra, il suo controllo può arrivare alle aree più vicine all'altra città, fino a quelle a essa direttamente adiacenti. Dal momento che una città trae sostentamento solo dall'area all'interno dei suoi confini culturali, questa situazione può limitare fortemente la crescita di una città fino a ridurla alla [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]carestia[\LINK]; può addirittura succedere che la città decida di legarsi a quella della civiltà più forte. Per maggiori dettagli, leggi la sezione relativa alla [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]cultura[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Conquistare città nemiche[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Quando ti impadronisci di una città nemica, essa deve cominciare a produrre cultura per espandere i suoi confini oltre la sua prima casella, e questo può avvenire solo dopo che è cessata la [LINK=CONCEPT_RESISTANCE]"resistenza"[\LINK] al suo interno. Non è insolito, per le città appena espugnate, che esse controllino solo poche caselle, almeno fino a quando il conquistatore non abbia cominciato a produrre cultura al loro interno.
TEXT.Spanish: La tierra que controla tu civilización (es decir, la tierra que está dentro de sus "fronteras") viene determinada por la cantidad de ciudades que tenga y la potencia cultural de éstas. Cuando construyes por vez primera una ciudad, sus fronteras suelen extenderse a las casillas directamente adyacentes a ella. A medida que crezca el [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]valor cultural[\LINK] de la ciudad, sus fronteras se extenderán a más casillas y acabarán por fundirse con las de otras ciudades cercanas.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Ver las fronteras[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Las casillas que están dentro de las fronteras de cada civilización están ligeramente teñidas de distintos colores. Las casillas controladas por los [LINK=CONCEPT_BARBARIANS]bárbaros[\LINK] están teñidas de negro. Si no estás seguro de quién posee alguna casilla, pon el cursor encima de ella y mira la "ayuda emergente". [H2]Efectos de las fronteras[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Las fronteras tienen varios efectos importantes. Las ciudades solo pueden obtener sustento de las casillas que estén dentro de sus fronteras y sus trabajadores solo pueden [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]"mejorar"[\LINK] dichas casillas (excepto en el caso de las carreteras y los ferrocarriles, que pueden construirse en cualquier lugar). Las unidades se curan más rápido dentro de tus fronteras, más lentamente en territorio neutral (sin dueño) y más lentamente todavía cuando se encuentren en tierra extranjera. Además, las unidades de otras civilizaciones (con algunas excepciones) no pueden entrar en tu territorio si no te han declarado la guerra, y viceversa. Los bárbaros pueden entrar en tu territorio, pero los animales no.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Choque de fronteras[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando tengas una ciudad cerca de una ciudad de otra civilización, ambas competirán por el [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]control cultural[\LINK] de las casillas que haya entre ellas. Por lo general, si la casilla es equidistante a las dos ciudades, la controlará la ciudad con la cultura más potente. Es importante tener en cuenta que, cuanto antes empiece una ciudad a producir cultura, más difícil será que una ciudad rival la eche de las casillas que controle. Las ciudades no tienen garantizado el control de una cantidad determinada de casillas. Si una supera culturalmente a otra, su control se extenderá a las casillas más cercanas a la otra, pudiendo llegar incluso a las que estén directamente adyacentes a ella. Ya que una ciudad solo puede sacar sustento de las casillas que estén en sus fronteras culturales, esto puede limitar mucho el crecimiento de una ciudad, dar lugar a una [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]hambruna[\LINK] o incluso hacer que la ciudad cambie de bando y se haga tributaria de la civilización invasora. Ver [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Cultura[\LINK] para obtener más detalles.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Capturar las ciudades enemigas[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando captures una ciudad enemiga, dicha ciudad deberá empezar a producir cultura para ampliar sus fronteras desde la primera casilla, y esto solo podrá ocurrir después de que la [LINK=CONCEPT_RESISTANCE]"resistencia"[\LINK] haya terminado en ella. Frecuentemente, las ciudades recién capturadas tienen el control de muy pocas casillas hasta que el conquistador empieza a producir cultura en ellas.

TEXT.English: by SimCutie[PARAGRAPH:2]This Mod will allow you to cycle through your cities from the Main Interface screen. Above your minimap in the Main Interface screen are a white left and right arrow. Clicking one of them will do a single-click action (pulling up city information in main interface, without detailed citizen information,) on the closest city in the main view.

by Chinese American[PARAGRAPH:2]This will add a bar to the City View that will show many turns are left until Culture will expand in the current city screen, as well as turns to a Great Person in the city screen. You can turn off these bars from within the BUG Options Screen, under the General Tab.

TEXT.Spanish: Turnos para expansión y Gran personaje

TEXT.English: by EmperorFool[PARAGRAPH:2]The Great General Progress Bar adds a bar below your Technology Research bar that tells you how many turns until your next Great General. If in wide screen mode it will display to the left of the Research bar. One thing to note is the display of the bar will not automatically update after a battle, but you must enter a screen and exit out for it to display properly. From within The BUG Options Screen, on the General Tab, you can turn the Great General Bar on or off.

TEXT.Spanish: Barra de progreso hacia Gran general

TEXT.English: by EmperorFool[PARAGRAPH:2]This mod provides an enhanced version of the Technology Chooser screen (F6). Along the bottom of the screen you will see five groups of three icons; each group consists of a great person icon and two technology icons. For each great person icon, the left technology icon shows which technology that great person will research given the technologies you have already researched. The right technology icon shows which technology they will research once you have researched all the technologies you have selected in the screen. Once a great person has no more technologies that it can research, it will show a red circle with a line through it for its technology icons; this is the same symbol used for "No State Religion".[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Instructions[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]You can enable or disable this mod using the BUG Options screen's (Ctrl-Alt-O) General tab. Simply toggle the "Great Person Research" check box in the first column.

by ruff_hi[PARAGRAPH:2]With version 3.13 of Beyond the Sword, the Glance Screen within the Advisor Screen was removed for "being too ugly." We felt the information given in this screen was vital, and so returned it to the Foreign Advisor screen, but improved. We realigned the grid, as well as adding the attitude icons, and color coding the modifiers. It should now be easier to see where you stand with your rivals.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Instructions[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Go to the Foreign Advisor Screen from the Main Interface, and click on Glance.

by Ruff_hi and EmperorFool[PARAGRAPH:2]The Military Advisor is now divided into two sections, Deployment, and the Sit-Rep (or Situation Report).[PARAGRAPH:2]The Deployment tab makes finding units easier by grouping units by location and unit type.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Sit-Rep tab is your all-in-one spot to find information related to your warmonging diplomacy. It displays the follow information:[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET]Icon for each Civilization in the game.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET]A fist indicating that the Civilization "Has Enough on Their Hands", which usually means they are planning, or are engaged in a war that is taking all their resources.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET]An icon display who the Civilzations Worst Enemy is.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET]A Threat Indicator. This is not perfect, but gives you a rough idea what the threat level of attack from that civilization is towards you.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET]Columns showing Strategic Advantages, both yours and the other civlizations. This is useful so you don't go attacking rifles with swordsman![PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET]An indicator for if that civilization is a vassal of another.[PARAGRAPH:2][ICON_BULLET]An indicator if the civilization has a defensive pact.

by TheLopez[PARAGRAPH:2]Just as the mod title says, this is not just another game clock mod. It is much, much more. This mod provides you the flexibility to most if not all of its different features. There are 12 main variables and one additional variable per era that can be used to configure the Not Just Another Game Clock Mod display information. Those variables are configurable within the BUG Options Screen.

Strategy Overlay allows player to plan where he wants to place his next cities by adding colored dots to the desired map plots. To activate Strategy Overlay edit mode, press [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ALT-X[COLOR_REVERT]. Select desired color from the palette on the left and then mouse left button to place a dot to map plot. The plot is surrounded with city radius to give you a clear picture how the land will be used if city is placed on that plot. To remove dot from plot hover your mouse pointer over it and right click. Press [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ALT-X[COLOR_REVERT] to exit Strategy Overlay edit mode. With [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]CTRL-X[COLOR_REVERT] you can turn on and off the overlay.

by EmperorFool[PARAGRAPH:2]You can enable or disable this mod using the BUG Options screen's (Ctrl-Alt-O) General tab. Simply toggle the "Raw Yield " check box in the first column under "City Screen". You can switch between the display of either Production, Commerce,or Food, by clicking on it's icon in the heard of the Yields display in the upper left quarter of the City Screen.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Raw Yields[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Raw Yields allows you to display a detailed breakdown of each of the tree production type: Commerce, Produce, and Food. To toggle between the modes, click on the icon representing each yield type in the Header. It will give you a detailed breakdown of what each raw yield is, as well as what the actual value is after modifers.[PARAGRAPH:2]It will add up the yields for worked tiles, all tiles in the cities control, or all tiles culturally owned. It will also eliminate the display of 0 values, to help reduce clutter and keep the list of buildings in the city as large as possible. Everything is displayed in a table format, and should be fairly easy to see what the raw yield a city is capable of as soon as you build it, so you know where to focus your improvements, and ensure your city is giving the most possible for your needs.[PARAGRAPH:2]This mod component was based of the original Raw Commerce Mod by Sevo.

by eotinb[PARAGRAPH:2][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Alt+R[COLOR_REVERT]: Creates a pop up window in which you set the number of turns until the reminder goes off and the text of the reminder. When that turn comes around, your reminder will appear as a message on the screen and in the event log (but only for a few turns). Also an alarm noise will play to get your attention. You can have as many reminders pending as you like. As of now there is no way to eliminate a reminder (other than passing the turn it is set to go off) or any way to view the current reminders. If I get ambitious, I may include these features in a future version.

by EmperorFool[PARAGRAPH:2]Whip Assistant will tell you how many hammers of overflow you will have if you hurry production by sacrificing your population. The overflow you receive is put towards your next build. So, for example, you can whip a library for 2 population with 32 hammer overflow means that it will take 2 of your population, but you will get the library the next turn, plus 32 hammers to whatever you build next.[PARAGRAPH:2]Whip Assistant will also add a counter to the city screen telling you how many turns until the Unhappiness caused by the Whipping, will expire.

When first constructed, a [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]city[\LINK] is little more than a wide place in the road with several rude huts scattered about. In order for the new city to function effectively, you must construct "buildings" in it. Buildings serve a wide variety of purposes in Civilization IV - walls protect military units during combat, temples make the citizens happier, barracks train troops created in the city, markets increase a city's wealth, and so on. Determining which buildings to construct when - and balancing the need to improve your cities versus the need to create units - will often spell the difference between a successful, prospering civilization and a weak and helpless one.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]How to Produce Buildings[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]City Production Menu:[\BOLD] When a city has completed its current production and is ready to build something else, the "City Production Menu" will appear on the screen. This menu displays everything that the city can produce, and may include workers, settlers, military units, buildings, wonders, gold, and so forth. At the top of the menu are displayed two "recommended" items that the game itself thinks you might want to create - but you never have to follow these recommendations. If you are uncertain what to build, highlighting each item with the mouse will display information about what they do. Click on the item you want to produce: construction will begin immediately, and you will be informed when it is complete.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]On the City Screen:[\BOLD] The city screen appears when you double-click on a city on the main map. The city production menu appears at the bottom of this screen (in a different format from the pop-up menu above); double-click on the building you wish to produce. Moving the mouse over the different icons will provide more information about them here as well.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Building Availability[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Not all buildings are available for you to construct at the start of the game. Building availability is determined by a number of factors:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Tech Requirements[\BOLD]: Many buildings have "tech requirements" - that is, you have to have discovered a certain technology before you can build a particular building. For instance, you cannot build a Granary until you have learned the Pottery technology.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Location Requirements:[\BOLD] Some buildings can be only constructed in cities in certain locations. These are usually fairly obvious: harbors, for example, may be built only in coastal cities.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Previous Construction Requirements:[\BOLD] Certain buildings cannot be built in a city unless other buildings have been constructed first. A city must contain a market and a grocery before you can build a bank there.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Religious Requirements:[\BOLD] Some buildings have religious prerequisites. For example, you cannot build a temple in a city until that city has acquired religion.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Time to Produce[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The time to produce a building is dependent upon the city's production output (see [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]Cities[\LINK] for more details) and the production cost of the building itself. For instance, if a city with a production output of 20 begins work on a building with a production cost of 100, it will take that city 5 turns to complete the building.[PARAGRAPH:2]Other factors may speed the time of production. Some civilizations get bonuses when constructing certain buildings. And access to specific resources - copper, stone, marble - may speed production on certain buildings; for example, the Pyramids can be built much faster with the stone resource. Further, certain [LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]Civics[\LINK] affect building production times.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Maintenance Costs[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Unlike previous Civilization games, there are no maintenance costs associated with buildings in Civilization IV. Maintenance costs are attached instead to [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]cities[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Capturing Buildings[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When you capture a city, some of its buildings may be destroyed, but others may remain intact for your use. Captured buildings function just like other buildings.
TEXT.French: Lorsque vous fondez une [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]ville[\LINK], il ne s'agit guère que de quelques huttes grossières construites au bord d'une route. Pour qu'une ville se développe efficacement, vous devez y construire des "bâtiments". Dans Civilization IV, les bâtiments ont des fonctions extrêmement variées: les murailles protègent les unités militaires pendant les combats, les petits lieux de culte rendent les habitants plus heureux, les casernes permettent d'entraîner les troupes, les marchés augmentent les revenus de la ville, etc. Savoir construire le bon bâtiment au bon moment (et trouver l'équilibre entre amélioration des villes et création d'unités), fait souvent la différence entre une civilisation prospère et une autre qui végète.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Construire un bâtiment[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Menu Production de la ville:[\BOLD] quand une ville termine une production, et peut donc en commencer une nouvelle, le menu "Production de la ville" apparaît à l'écran. Ce menu affiche tout ce que la ville peut produire: ouvriers, colons, unités militaires, bâtiments, merveilles, or, etc. En haut du menu apparaissent les deux productions "recommandées" par le moteur du jeu, mais rien ne vous oblige à suivre ces propositions. En cas de doute, placez la souris sur un des éléments du menu pour afficher une fenêtre d'information. Cliquez sur l'élément à produire, la construction démarre aussitôt et vous serez informé lorsque le bâtiment sera terminé.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Ecran de ville:[SPACE][\BOLD] l'écran de ville s'affiche lorsque vous double-cliquez sur une ville depuis la carte principale. Le menu de production de la ville occupe le bas de l'écran (sous un format différent de celui de la fenêtre vue ci-dessus). Double-cliquez sur le bâtiment que vous voulez produire. Déplacez la souris sur les différents icones pour obtenir des informations sur les bâtiments.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Disponibilité des bâtiments[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]En début de partie, tous les bâtiments ne sont pas disponibles. La disponibilité d'un bâtiment dépend de plusieurs facteurs.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Conditions technologiques:[\BOLD] de nombreux bâtiments sont soumis à des "conditions technologiques". En clair, vous devez découvrir une certaine technologie avant de construire tel type de bâtiments. Par exemple, vous ne pourrez construire des greniers qu'après avoir découvert la poterie.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Conditions géographiques:[\BOLD] certains bâtiments ne peuvent être construits que dans des villes répondant à des critères géographiques.
